p: One of the most successful events of inactivation in liquid medium, including work on bacteriophages ( Box 3), was achieved by a 15 s treatment of FCV using a plasma jet [ 21, 22]. This extremely short treatment time indicates that plasma jets could be an important tool for enteric virus inactivation in liquids; however, based on its present configuration, it would be limited to the treatment of smaller objects contaminated with potentially infected droplets.
